verses.verse: And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Hew<WH6458> thee two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68> like unto the first<WH7223>: and I will write<WH3789> upon the tables<WH3871> the words<WH1697> that were on the first<WH7223> tables<WH3871>, which thou brakest<WH7665>.

And be ready<WH3559> by the morning<WH1242>, and come up<WH5927> in the morning<WH1242> unto mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>, and present<WH5324> thyself there to me on the top<WH7218> of the mount<WH2022>.

And no man<WH376> shall come up<WH5927> with thee<WH408>; neither let any man<WH376> be seen<WH7200> throughout all the mount<WH2022>; neither let the flocks<WH6629> nor herds<WH1241> feed<WH7462> before<WH4136> that mount<WH2022>.

And he hewed<WH6458> two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68> like unto the first<WH7223>; and Moses<WH4872> rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and went up<WH5927> unto mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>, as Jehovah<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> him<WH3947>, and took in his hand<WH3027> two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> descended<WH3381> in the cloud<WH6051>, and stood<WH3320> with him there<WH7121>, and proclaimed the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> passed by<WH5674> before him<WH6440>, and proclaimed<WH7121>, Jehovah<WH3068>, Jehovah<WH3068>, a God<WH410> merciful<WH7349> and gracious<WH2587>, slow to anger<WH750>, and abundant<WH7227> in lovingkindness<WH2617> and truth<WH571>;

keeping <WH5341> lovingkindness<WH2617> for thousands<WH505>, forgiving<WH5375> iniquity<WH5771> and transgression<WH6588> and sin<WH2403>; and that will by no means<WH5352> clear<WH5352> the guilty<WH6485>, visiting the iniquity<WH5771> of the fathers<WH1> upon the children<WH1121>, and upon the children<WH1121>'s children<WH8029>, upon the third and upon the fourth generation<WH7256>.
And Moses<WH4872> made haste<WH4116>, and bowed his head<WH6915> toward the earth<WH776>, and worshipped<WH7812>.

And he said<WH559>, If now I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, O Lord<WH136>, let the Lord<WH136>, I pray thee<WH3212>, go in the midst<WH7130> of us<WH7186>; for it is a stiffnecked people<WH5971>; and pardon<WH5545> our iniquity<WH5771> and our sin<WH2403>, and take us for thine inheritance<WH5157>.

And he said<WH559>, Behold<WH3772>, I make a covenant<WH1285>: before all thy people<WH5971> I will do<WH6213> marvels<WH6381>, such as have not been wrought<WH1254> in all the earth<WH776>, nor in any nation<WH1471>; and all the people<WH5971> among<WH7130> which thou art shall see<WH7200> the work<WH4639> of Jehovah<WH3068>; for it is a terrible thing<WH3372> that I do with thee<WH6213>.

Observe <WH8104> thou that which I command<WH6680> thee this day<WH3117>: behold<WH1644>, I drive out before<WH6440> thee the Amorite<WH567>, and the Canaanite<WH3669>, and the Hittite<WH2850>, and the Perizzite<WH6522>, and the Hivite<WH2340>, and the Jebusite<WH2983>.

Take heed<WH8104> to thyself<WH3772>, lest thou make a covenant<WH1285> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776> whither thou goest<WH935>, lest it be for a snare<WH4170> in the midst of thee<WH7130>:
but ye shall break<WH7665> down their altars<WH4196>, and dash<WH7665> in pieces their pillars<WH4676>, and ye shall cut down<WH3772> their Asherim<WH842>
(for thou shalt worship<WH7812> no other<WH312> god<WH410>: for Jehovah<WH3068>, whose name<WH8034> is Jealous<WH7067>, is a jealous<WH7067> God<WH410>);

lest thou make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>, and they play the harlot<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>, and sacrifice<WH2076> unto their gods<WH430>, and one call<WH7121> thee and thou eat<WH398> of his sacrifice<WH2077>;

and thou take<WH3947> of their daughters<WH1323> unto thy sons<WH1121>, and their daughters<WH1323> play the harlot<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>, and make<WH2181> thy sons<WH1121> play the harlot<WH2181> after<WH310> their gods<WH430>.
Thou shalt make<WH6213> thee no molten<WH4541> gods<WH430>.

The feast<WH2282> of unleavened bread<WH4682> shalt thou keep<WH8104>. Seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> thou shalt eat<WH398> unleavened bread<WH4682>, as I commanded<WH6680> thee<WH4150>, at the time appointed in the month<WH2320> Abib<WH24>; for in the month<WH2320> Abib<WH24> thou camest out<WH3318> from Egypt<WH4714>.
All that openeth<WH6363> the womb<WH7358> is mine<WH4735>; and all thy cattle that is male<WH2142>, the firstlings<WH6363> of cow<WH7794> and sheep<WH7716>.

And the firstling<WH6363> of an ass<WH2543> thou shalt redeem<WH6299> with a lamb<WH7716>: and if thou wilt not redeem<WH6299> it<WH6202>, then thou shalt break its neck. All the first-born<WH1060> of thy sons<WH1121> thou shalt redeem<WH6299>. And none shall appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> me empty<WH7387>.
Six <WH8337> days<WH3117> thou shalt work<WH5647>, but on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> thou shalt rest<WH7673>: in plowing time<WH2758> and in harvest<WH7105> thou shalt rest<WH7673>.

And thou shalt observe<WH6213> the feast<WH2282> of weeks<WH7620>, even of the first-fruits<WH1061> of wheat<WH2406> harvest<WH7105>, and the feast<WH2282> of ingathering<WH614> at the year<WH8141>'s end<WH8622>.
Three <WH6471> times in the year<WH8141> shall all thy males<WH2138> appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH113> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

For I will cast out<WH3423> nations<WH1471> before<WH6440> thee<WH7337>, and enlarge thy borders<WH1366>: neither shall any man<WH376> desire<WH2530> thy land<WH776>, when thou goest up<WH5927> to appear<WH7200> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> three<WH6471> times in the year<WH8141>.

Thou shalt not offer<WH7819> the blood<WH1818> of my sacrifice<WH2077> with leavened<WH2557> bread<WH2077>; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast<WH2282> of the passover<WH6453> be left<WH3885> unto the morning<WH1242>.

The first<WH7225> of the first-fruits<WH1061> of thy ground<WH127> thou shalt bring<WH935> unto the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>. Thou shalt not boil<WH1310> a kid<WH1423> in its mother<WH517>'s milk<WH2461>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Write<WH3789> thou these words<WH1697>: for after the tenor<WH6310> of these words<WH1697> I have made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with thee and with Israel<WH3478>.

And he was there with Jehovah<WH3068> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>; he did neither eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>. And he wrote<WH3789> upon the tables<WH3871> the words<WH1697> of the covenant<WH1285>, the ten<WH6235> commandments<WH1697>.

And it came to pass<WH4872>, when Moses came down<WH3381> from mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514> with the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of the testimony<WH5715> in Moses<WH4872>' hand<WH3027>, when he came down<WH3381> from the mount<WH2022>, that Moses<WH4872> knew<WH3045> not that the skin<WH5785> of his face<WH6440> shone<WH7160> by reason of his speaking with him<WH1696>.

And when Aaron<WH175> and all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> Moses<WH4872>, behold<WH5785>, the skin of his face<WH6440> shone<WH7160>; and they were afraid<WH3372> to come nigh him<WH5066>.
And Moses<WH4872> called<WH7121> unto them<WH175>; and Aaron and all the rulers<WH5387> of the congregation<WH5712> returned<WH7725> unto him<WH4872>: and Moses spake to them<WH1696>.

And afterward<WH310> all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came nigh<WH5066>: and he gave them in commandment<WH6680> all that Jehovah<WH3068> had spoken<WH1696> with him in mount<WH2022> Sinai<WH5514>.
And when Moses<WH4872> had done<WH3615> speaking<WH1696> with them<WH5414>, he put a veil<WH4533> on his face<WH6440>.

But when Moses<WH4872> went in<WH935> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068> to speak<WH1696> with him<WH5493>, he took the veil<WH4533> off<WH5493>, until he came out<WH3318>; and he came out<WH3318>, and spake<WH1696> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> that which he was commanded<WH6680>.

And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> the face<WH6440> of Moses<WH4872>, that the skin<WH5785> of Moses<WH4872>' face<WH6440> shone<WH7160>; and Moses<WH4872> put<WH7725> the veil<WH4533> upon his face<WH6440> again<WH7725>, until he went<WH935> in to speak with him<WH1696>.
